overview:
Matthew is an entrepreneur at the intersection of product design and business, collaborating with engineers and designers to build software applications.

He is fascinated in people as the perfect medium of creative expression for achieving goals based on unified vision, technical expertise, and team work. He combines user-centered design, cogent story telling, research, testing, and data analysis with a keen insight into leveraging new opportunities. He is passionate about the human story and how it shapes the design, development, and distribution of new products.

Matthew caught the proverbial entrepreneurial itch in grad school at Berkeley and has never looked back. He is a food lover, traveler, film aficionado, and someone who deeply appreciates design, ingenuity, and building things.

Matthew cofounded FounderLY as a way of giving back to the startup and open source communities. He currently works as cofounder of Cosemble, a social platform for creating events, selling tickets, and sharing experiences with the people and organizations you care about.

Matthew is a military veteran having served as a U.S. Naval Corpsman with the 3rd Marine Expeditionary Force. He received a B.A. from UC San Diego and a J.D. from Berkeley Law.
